title: Watergate Forest Park Walking Route

images.title: Chris Tweedy / Watergate Forest Park
images.caption: Footbridge over the lake. The park is situated on the site of the former Watergate Colliery and is managed by Gateshead Council.

images.title: Dave Dodson / CC BY (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0)
images.caption: Rabbit in the park. There's plenty of wildlife to see in the park with a variety of woodland and water loving birds.

images.title: Western end of Watergate park by Robert Graham, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Western end of Watergate park

images.title: Stream through Washingwell Wood by Robert Graham, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Stream through Washingwell Wood to the west of the lake.

images.title: The Miner's Steps by Robert Graham, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Miner's Steps. A wooded area to the north west of the lake.

images.title: Waterfall by peter maddison, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Waterfall

description: The popular park is located on the site of the former Watergate colliery in Gateshead. It includes woodland trails, a pretty lake, a waterfall and wildflower meadows. In the park there are two waymarked walking trails to try. One circular trail takes you around the lake while the second nature trail visits a series of sculptures. There are also cycling trails on the bridleways and permissive paths on the site. You can start the walk from the main car park at the eastern end of the site, just off the B6317 Whickham Highway at Lobley Hill. From here you can pick up the footpaths heading south west towards the lake and the Washingwell Woods.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The on site Watergate Café is a nice place for refreshments after your exercise. It's located through the small car park next to Emmanuel College.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is ideal for dog walking so you'll probably see plenty of other owners on a fine day.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking in the area you could head west and visit Derwent Walk Country Park. There's nice riverside trails along the Derwent River on the Derwent Valley Walk which runs through the park. There's also the adjacent Thornley Woods where there's a good visitor centre and a sculpture trail.

display_address: Tanfield Railway Path, Lobley Hill, Whickham, Gateshead, Tyne and Wear, North East, England, NE11 9RR, United Kingdom
